result.execSummary:
The defendant Felecia R Busch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 68 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 & 3, if revoked.

Court will allow transfer to either Jefferson or Dodge County.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 & 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Ben Zautner.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 & 3, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs ($243) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.

Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Felecia R Busch in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.   
State files an amended information making all three counts misdemeanors.

Defendant pleads Guilty to all three counts.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of all three amended counts.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
9  Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
68 Days Credit.
Concurrent to all other counts.
Stayed 

Term of Probation:    2 Years
Concurrent to all other counts
Court will allow transfer to either Jefferson or Dodge County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Ben Zautner
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

COURT COSTS:  $ 243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives
To be paid as a condition of probation


Count 2:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to all other counts.
Stayed

Term of Probation:  2 Years
Concurrent to all other counts.
Court will allow transfer to either Jefferson or Dodge County
Conditions of Probation:
Same as count 1.

Court Costs:  $243
To be paid as a condition of probation.



Count 3:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to all other counts.
Stayed

Term of Probation:  2 Years
Concurrent to all other counts.
Court will allow transfer to either Jefferson or Dodge County
Conditions of Probation:
Same as count 1.

Court Costs:  $243
To be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant to contact Probation by 9:00 a.m. on 10/03/14.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Felecia R Busch in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.   
File not called on the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Felecia R Busch in court, in custody, with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.   Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant moves to modify bail.  State objects.  Court denies motion to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed on 7/28/14.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Felecia R Busch in court, in custody, with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary time limits waived. Defendant allowed non-collect calls.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
